net.openhft.chronicle

Interface ExcerptAppender

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Appendable, AutoCloseable, net.openhft.lang.io.Bytes, net.openhft.lang.io.BytesCommon, net.openhft.lang.io.serialization.BytesMarshallable, net.openhft.lang.io.BytesStore, net.openhft.lang.io.ByteStringAppender, net.openhft.lang.io.ByteStringParser, CharSequence, DataInput, DataOutput, ExcerptCommon, ObjectInput, ObjectOutput, RandomAccess, net.openhft.lang.io.RandomDataInput, net.openhft.lang.io.RandomDataOutput, net.openhft.lang.io.RandomDataUpdate, net.openhft.lang.ReferenceCounted
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    VanillaChronicle.VanillaAppender
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AppenderAdapter, CheckedExcerpt, WrappedExcerpt, WrappedExcerptAppender, WrappedExcerptAppenders.ByteBufferBytesAppender, WrappedExcerptAppenders.ByteBufferBytesExcerptAppenderWrapper, WrappedExcerpts.ByteBufferBytesExcerptWrapper

    public interface ExcerptAppender
extends ExcerptCommon
    The component that facilitates sequentially writing data to a Chronicle.
    Author:
    peter.lawrey

    • Method Detail

      • startExcerpt

        void startExcerpt()
        Start an excerpt with the default message capacity of 128K (can be configured) This can waste up to 0.1% of disk space, unless you have sparse file support like Linux, when you will waste far less.

      • startExcerpt

        void startExcerpt(long capacity)
        Ensure there is enough capacity for a new entry of up to the size given. If there is not enough space left in the chunk of memory mapped file, a padded entry is added and a new entry at the start of a new chunk is commenced. The capacity can be more than you need as finish() will shrink wrap the entry. It is onl a waste if you trigger a padded entry when none was required.
        Parameters:
        capacity - to allow for, but not exceed.

      • addPaddedEntry

        void addPaddedEntry()
        Add a padded entry to keep the index in sync with a master source.

        Not for public use. This method is expected to be retained only as a package private method in a future release.

      • nextSynchronous

        boolean nextSynchronous()
        The default value is ChronicleConfig.synchronousMode()
        Returns:
        will the next write be synchronous

      • nextSynchronous

        void nextSynchronous(boolean nextSynchronous)
        Parameters:
        nextSynchronous - make the next write synchronous or not.

      • lastWrittenIndex

        long lastWrittenIndex()
        Returns:
        the index last written to including padded entries.
